channel.title: Games on 2D Steve
channel.description: Recent content in Games on 2D Steve

item.title: Red Dead Redemption II
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eaW0tYpxyp0 There are games that I’ve played that have left an impression on me.

item.title: God of War
item.description: I have never played a God of War game. It was just a whole series of action game that looked super fun, but I didn’t have a PlayStation and it wasn’t enough to pull me in.

item.title: Dungeon Mastering
item.description: On Tuesday of next week, Iâ€™ll be dungeon mastering for the first time in maybe six years.

item.title: Grim Fandango - Part 1
item.description: I started the Grim Fandango stream last night! I forgot how much I really loved this game.

item.title: Double Fine Adventure
item.description: I am such a ridiculously HUGE fan of Double Fine Adventure.

item.title: Finished The Cave
item.description: I finished the cave on The Adventures of Stephen last night.

item.title: The Rhythm of Dark Souls
item.description: I never played Dark Souls 3. I’m almost ashamed to say that I’ve never played a Dark Souls game at all.

item.title: Streaming The Cave
item.description: It’s adventure game night! I’m playing The Cave for the next couple of weeks.

item.title: Stardew Valley
item.description: Stardew Valley is an amazing game. It’s nothing new, and I’ve payed it before, but for whatever reason it really hooked me this time.

item.title: Streaming!
item.description: I have a had a blast picking up the hobby of streaming video games online.

item.title: Of Star Wars and Skyrim
item.description: I just realized that I have yet to write a blog post about what may very well be the most culturally significant announcement of this year.

item.title: Sim City
item.description: I got into the beta to the newest edition of Sim City!

item.title: Assassin's Creed!
item.description: I beat it! But not before it stole me away from blogging again.

item.title: New Year's Creed
item.description: I decided that this year I would try to spend a bit more time blogging about stuff, or just writing in general.

item.title: 2011 Geek Week
item.description: I don’t know who timed this majestic week in the life of nerds everywhere, but they did something right.

item.title: 5000 Meters
item.description: Aha! The blog is still here with just a little dust sprinkled on the cover.

item.title: Xbox, How I Missed Thee
item.description: This post is going to kind of work as a supplement to my “Broken Addiction” post from a few days ago.

item.title: Touch Me
item.description: Okay, before you freak out over the title of this post, I’m talking about computers with touch surfaces.

item.title: Broken Addiction
item.description: I am happy to say that for the last 3 months I have been completely World of Warcraft free!

item.title: Morality Games
item.description: My big addiction for the past few days has been a wonderful little Xbox 360 game called “Dragon Age: Origins.

item.title: Sick @ Home
item.description: I can’t stand missing work. As much as I like being at home, I do NOT like being at home on days when I am supposed to be working.

item.title: Bad News...Twice!
item.description: This week has been particularly devastating for geeks everywhere. Gary Gygax, creator of the tabletop role-playing adventure game Dungeons and Dragons, has died.

item.title: Red Pants and Blue Pants return for more butt kicking action!
item.description: If this doesn’t bring back good memories, I don’t know what does.
